info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 5:00AM EST until December 19 at 8:13AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Schuylkill River At Pottstown affecting Montgomery County. For the Schuylkill River...including Philadelphia near 30th Street, Berne, Reading, Pottstown, Norristown, Philadelphia...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Schuylkill River at Pottstown. * WHEN...From this evening to Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Sewers in the Pottstown area, due to high and backwater effects, begin to flood. At 12.5 feet, Portions of PA Route 724 along the Berks/Chester county line begin to flood, specifically Union Township in Berks county and North Coventry Township in Chester county. At 13.0 feet, Portions of PA Route 724 along the Berks/Chester county line are closed due to high water, specifically Union Township in Berks county and North Coventry Township in Chester county. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM EST Monday the stage was 7.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 12.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 12.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.9 feet on 07/12/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Schuylkill River Pottstown 12.5 7.9 Mon 4 am 11.3 7.6 12.8 1am 12/19 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 500 PM EST.
